A Parent Guide: Support Your Child During Virtual Learning

WOW!! We are on Parent Tip #8 of 8 you completed the series that is aimed at figuring how we can make your child's virtual school experience fun, rewarding, and a good experience for everyone involved. We saved the best for last!

We want to do our part to keep BUSD a safe and healthy learning environment. Preparing your child now, by allowing them time to get used to wearing a mask will help keep everyone safe and healthy when they return to school.

I know there are many concerns surrounding the COVID-19 Pandemic. I will be meeting with my entire administrative team on Monday, March 16, 2020 to review all the latest information we have received on the Virus. We are also actively and consistently implementing our sanitizing protocols in our classrooms, office spaces and busses.
Please use safety protocols to keep your children home if they have a fever, cough or are sneezing.
I will have a decision on any changes to classes by tomorrow afternoon.
Thank you all and stay healthy,
Dr. Edna Morris
Superintendent

You may ask yourself:
How Does the 2020 Census Affect my family??

The 2020 Census count impacts the federal funds that communities receive each year for programs and services that are critical for schools, students, and elders such as:
Special education
Head Start
After-school programs
Classroom technology.
Food assistance, including free and reduced-price school lunches.
Maternal and child health programs like WIC
Elderly programs
Funding for roads, hospitals, and housing programs

It is vital that the Tohono O'odham Nation get an accurate population count because the count affects our community for the next 10 years.
BUSD is a proud partner of the Tohono O'odham Nation's Complete Count Committee. BE COUNTED!

School attendance is a simple, easily understood measure of student performance. One strategy for improving attendance at Indian Oasis Intermediate Campus is going beyond sanctions and instead including an incentive movie party for students who missed 1 or NO days during a set period of time. We are happy to report that 160 students earned a ticket to the party!

Good attendance helps kids succeed in school and boosts
their self-esteem. One of our top priorities at BUSD is improving attendance. Please continue to help us by getting your child to school, every day and on time.

ATTENDANCE MATTERS

According to national data, more than 8 million students are missing so many days of school that they are academically at risk.

Chronic absence — missing 10 percent or more of school days due to absence for any reason—excused, unexcused absences and suspensions, can translate into third-graders unable to master reading, sixth-graders failing subjects and ninth-graders dropping out of high school.

At BUSD we want to improve the attendance rates for our students at all grade levels. Please reach out to your child’s school if you’re having attendance related issues. Together, we can make sure our students are in class, on time, everyday. Remember good attendance habits start in Pre-K.

Together, we can improve the lives of our children. BUSD is committed to being a trauma informed school district.

Karyn Purvis Institute of Child Development is with Cognitive Media.
June 11, 2019 at 8:00 PM ·

When a child from a hard place doesn't feel safe, the result is often behaviors that appear willful, baffling, and infuriating to caregivers. How we respond is critical.

In this TBRI Animate, we walk through the IDEAL Response for dealing with behaviors, an approach that addresses behavior while building connection between the child and caregiver.

Good evening BUSD Families and Staff,

The National Weather Service has announced a flash flood watch for the Tohono O'odham Nation from Wednesday 8 AM until 8 PM. Showers and scattered thunderstorms are expected to increase throughout the day. In order to keep our children safe, we will be cancelling school Wednesday, September 25, 2019. We will resume classes on Thursday, September 26, 2019.

We will send out notice of our make up day after I meet with my administrative team.

Thank you for your continued support. Please be safe and take precautions around any washes or saturated roads.

Superintendent Morris
